PSF photometry

class sphot.psf.PSFFitter(cutoutdata)

Bases: object

fit(fit_to='sersic_residual', **kwargs)
sphot.psf.do_psf_photometry(data, psfimg, psf_oversample, psf_sigma, th=2, Niter=3, fit_shape=(3, 3), render_shape=(25, 25), max_relative_error_flux=0.2, plot=True, **kwargs)

Performs PSF photometry. Main function to run PSF photometry. :param data: the data to perform PSF photometry. :type data: 2d array :param psfimg: the PSF image. :type psfimg: 2d array :param psf_sigma: the HWHM of the PSF. Use FWHM/2 :type psf_sigma: float :param psf_oversample: the oversampling factor of the PSF. :type psf_oversample: int :param th: the detection threshold in background STD. :type th: float :param Niter: the number of iterations to repeat the photometry (after cleaning up the data). :type Niter: int :param fit_shape: the shape of the fit. :type fit_shape: 2-tuple :param render_shape: the shape of each PSF to be rendered. :type render_shape: 2-tuple

Returns:

the photometry result. model_img (2d array): the model image. resid (2d array): the residual image.

Return type:

phot_result (QTable)

sphot.psf.filter_psfphot_results(phot_result, center_mask_params=None, cfit_percentiles=[5, 95], qfit_percentiles=[0, 90], max_relative_error_flux=0.2, data_shape=None, **kwargs)

Filter the PSF photometry results.

sphot.psf.iterative_psf_fitting(data, psfimg, psf_sigma, psf_oversample, threshold_list, progress=None, progress_text='Running iPSF...', **kwargs)

Perform iterative PSF fitting.

sphot.psf.make_modelimg(fit_models, shape, psf_shape)

modified version of photutil's function. No background is added. :param fit_models: list of PSF models

Returns:

rendered model image

Return type:

model_img

sphot.psf.sigma_clip_outside_aperture(data, r_eff, clip_sigma=4, aper_size_in_r_eff=1, plot=True)
